text:
- We chose AWS due to
their top tier support,

their scalability, and
our engineer's familiarity
with the products.

We also really respect
the API first approach,
which means that we can integrate it
with our internal tooling as well.
(upbeat music)
- Leonardo AI is a generative AI platform.
We are focused on content creation,

and really I think what
we're trying to solve
is reducing the friction between ideation,
creation, and bringing, you know,

what is really quite a
revolutionary, I guess, shift

in terms of what's
possible today to everyone.
And that includes both consumers
and B2B enterprise use cases as well.
Where we are right now,
we're really focused on 2D image creation.

That's sort of at the core of
our offering at the moment.

- Leonardo AI is an amazing
story about a company

who's been able to innovate and
get to market super quickly.
This company's less than 12 months old
and they've built a phenomenal product
which has had a global reach.

We are very proud to be
working with Leonardo AI
in deploying their model globally

through thousands of
users here in Australia,
but also in North America, in Europe,

in Japan, in India,
across the whole world,
providing global scale, reach,

whilst keeping it secure
and reliable to run.

- AWS have provided us
with so many opportunities.

They've connected us with
so many key partners,

and they've also organized
many consulting sessions
to really level up our engineers.

I mean, we work with generative
AI, which is relatively new

to the space in working
with GPU workloads,
which are so much different from working
with traditional CPU workloads.

So AWS's guidance has really
helped us achieve our goals
in a really short amount of time.

- We sort of started
from the gaming space.

Obviously, we see huge
application across gaming,
people using it in pre-production
as well as post-production creation,
as well as texture creation for 3D assets,
film, TV, concepting, storyboarding,
advertising and marketing.
Obviously loads of different ways
that you can create really exciting,
engaging visual content with the platform.
Architecture as well, interior design,
ways of visualizing rough concept sketches

and turning them into
polished, finished works

that can be used for presenting
for clients and so on.
So there's a really, really broad range
of use cases and beyond that.

- With AWS, customers get
to choose how they want

to use generative AI
within their business.

You can use generative
AI applications from AWS
to build your own models.

You can use pre-trained models
and build your applications
on top of those pre-trained models,
or you can use AWS services

that have generative AI
capability built into them,
and not having the need to worry
about training and deploying models.
All of this is managed in a very secure
and reliable infrastructure.

- Hosting in the cloud is
the only option we have

because at the scale of the
amount of users that we need
and the GPUs that we need to power that,

and the ability to move to
the next generation of GPUs
is something that's only easily done
through cloud services like AWS.

Through the AWS Generative
AI Accelerator Event,

we were introduced to
so many industry leaders

who are all working on so
many exciting products,

and we still use some of them
to this day to help grow us.

- Hundreds of thousands of
startups across the world
have benefited from AWS Activate.

The program itself is built
to provide support to startups

in the time that they
need early stage support.

So we provide expertise around
how to scale your business,

grow your business, build
world class architecture,

both within AWS skills, but
also through the ecosystem.
In fact, every 10 minutes,

a startup signs onto
AWS activate globally.

- AWS have easily enabled us
to scale outside of Australia,
bringing our content closer to customers
in the US, Asia, and Europe.

- We have a more expansive
view about where things can go,

and we really see image
generation as sort of the seed

of something much bigger in
terms of content creation.

And we're really interested,
both from a consumer

and B2B enterprise perspective,
of where we can take things.
